guru ji please tell me something of your
life I was squatted on a straw mat near
his tiger skin the friendly stars were
very close it seemed beyond the balcony
my family name was Priya at Nath car I
was born here in Serampore where father
was a wealthy businessman
he left me this ancestral mansion now my
Hermitage my formal schooling was little
I found it slow and shallow in early
manhood I undertook the responsibilities

now married my middle life was blessed

wife died I joined the Swamy Order and
received a new name of Sri yukteshwar
Giri such are my simple animals masters
smiled at my eager face like all
biographical sketches his words had
given the outward facts without
revealing the inner man
guru ji I would like to hear some

Yukteswar his eyes twinkled with his
warning my mother once tried to frighten

having missed the ghost mother never
told me another horror tale Morel look

possessing appearance moral attachment
is blinding it lends an imaginary halo

I met expenses by investing my family

under my
